sentence.text: CONCLUSIONS osteoblast differentiation-1 is highly expressed in human esophageal carcinoma, and could be a marker for use in assessing tumor stage and the deciding on treatment target

RESULTS osteoblast differentiation-1 was associated with patient age, gender, lymphatic metastasis, tumor recurrence, and stage, with significantly (P<0.05) positive correlations with age, lymphatic metastasis, tumor recurrence, and stage.

We investigated glioma-associated oncogene protein-1 (osteoblast differentiation-1) expression in human esophageal carcinoma tissue and the inhibition of cyclopamine on EC9706 esophageal carcinoma cell growth.
